exercises.name: Surya Namaskara
primaryBenefits: Balances all doshas when done mindfully
steps: Pranamasana (Prayer Pose) - Stand with palms together at heart center
Hastauttanasana (Raised Arms Pose) - Inhale, sweep arms up overhead
Uttanasana (Standing Forward Bend) - Exhale, hinge forward from hips
Ashwa Sanchalanasana (Low Lunge) - Inhale, step right foot back
Dandasana (Plank Pose) - Step left foot back, hold plank
Ashtanga Namaskara (Eight-Limbed Pose) - Lower knees, chest, chin
Bhujangasana (Cobra Pose) - Inhale, open chest forward
Adho Mukha Svanasana (Downward Dog) - Exhale, tuck toes, lift hips
Ashwa Sanchalanasana (Low Lunge) - Inhale, step right foot forward
Uttanasana (Standing Forward Bend) - Exhale, step left foot forward
Hastauttanasana (Raised Arms Pose) - Inhale, sweep arms up
Pranamasana (Prayer Pose) - Exhale, hands to heart center

modifications.vata: Move slowly with awareness, hold poses longer
modifications.pitta: Avoid overheating, practice in cooler environment
modifications.kapha: Increase pace and repetitions for warmth

exercises.name: Nadi Shodhana Pranayama
primaryBenefits: Harmonizes left and right brain hemispheres
steps: Sit comfortably with spine erect
Use right thumb to close right nostril
Inhale slowly through left nostril for 4 counts
Use ring finger to close left nostril, release thumb
Exhale slowly through right nostril for 4 counts
Inhale through right nostril for 4 counts
Close right nostril, release left nostril
Exhale through left nostril for 4 counts
This completes one round - repeat 5-10 times

modifications.vata: Keep breath gentle and steady, don't strain
modifications.pitta: Keep breath cool and calm, avoid forceful breathing

exercises.name: Vrikshasana
steps: Stand tall with feet hip-width apart
Shift weight to left foot, ground through all four corners
Bend right knee, place right foot on inner left thigh
Avoid placing foot on side of knee joint
Find steady gaze point (drishti) ahead
Bring palms together at heart center
Hold for 5-10 breaths
Lower right foot slowly and repeat on other side

modifications.vata: Use wall support, focus on steadiness over height
modifications.kapha: Add arm variations, increase holding time

exercises.name: Bhramari Pranayama
steps: Sit comfortably with spine straight
Close eyes and take a few natural breaths
Place thumbs in ears to block external sound
Place index fingers above eyebrows
Place remaining fingers over closed eyelids gently
Inhale normally through nose
Exhale making a humming sound like a bee
Feel vibration in head and chest
Complete 5-10 rounds

modifications.kapha: Can increase intensity slightly for stimulation

exercises.name: Balasana
exercises.bestTimeToPerform: End of practice or when needing rest
steps: Kneel on floor with big toes touching
Separate knees about hip-width apart
Sit back toward heels
Fold forward, extending arms in front
Rest forehead on mat or block
Breathe deeply and surrender
Hold for desired duration

modifications.vata: Use props for comfort, stay longer
modifications.kapha: Don't stay too long, use as brief rest

exercises.name: Ujjayi Pranayama
steps: Sit with spine erect or lie down comfortably
Breathe naturally through nose for a few rounds
Begin to slightly constrict throat on inhale
Create soft ocean-like sound on both inhale and exhale
Keep mouth closed, breathe only through nose
Maintain smooth, even rhythm
Continue for desired duration

modifications.pitta: Practice in cool environment, don't overheat
modifications.kapha: Can be more vigorous to increase heat

exercises.name: Paschimottanasana
steps: Sit with legs extended straight in front
Ground through sitting bones
Inhale, lengthen spine and lift chest
Exhale, hinge forward from hips
Keep spine long, avoid rounding
Reach for feet, shins, or use strap
Breathe deeply and surrender forward
Hold with awareness and compassion

modifications.vata: Use props, bend knees if needed, go slowly
modifications.pitta: Avoid forcing, stay cool and patient
modifications.kapha: Can work more actively, build heat

exercises.name: Trataka Meditation
steps: Sit comfortably 3-4 feet from candle flame
Light candle and dim other lights
Gaze steadily at flame without blinking
Keep eyes relaxed, don't strain
When eyes water, close them gently
Visualize flame in space between eyebrows
Open eyes and gaze again
Alternate between external and internal gazing

modifications.vata: Start with shorter sessions, use stable setup
modifications.pitta: Avoid if eyes are irritated, keep cool
modifications.kapha: Can practice longer sessions for mental clarity

exercises.name: Marjaryasana-Bitilasana
steps: Come to hands and knees (tabletop position)
Align wrists under shoulders, knees under hips
Inhale, drop belly, lift chest and tailbone (Cow)
Exhale, round spine, tuck chin to chest (Cat)
Move slowly with breath awareness
Continue flowing between poses
Complete 5-10 rounds

modifications.kapha: Can increase pace for more energy

exercises.name: Savasana

doshaEffects.kapha: Can be sedating if too long

steps: Lie on back with legs slightly apart
Allow feet to fall open naturally
Place arms alongside body, palms up
Close eyes and release all effort
Systematically relax each body part
Allow breath to flow naturally
Rest in complete stillness
Exit slowly by wiggling fingers and toes

modifications.vata: Use props for comfort, stay warm
modifications.kapha: Don't stay too long, set timer

Asana.description: Physical postures that prepare the body and mind for meditation

Pranayama.description: Breathing practices that control and expand life force energy

Meditation.description: Mental practices for developing awareness and inner peace

vata.idealTiming: Regular schedule, preferably morning and evening
vata.seasonalFocus: Extra attention during autumn and early winter

pitta.idealTiming: Early morning or evening, avoid midday heat
pitta.seasonalFocus: Cooling practices during summer and late spring

kapha.idealTiming: Early morning practice ideal, avoid evening sluggishness
kapha.seasonalFocus: Invigorating practices during spring and late winter
kapha.avoidances: Excessive sedentary poses, overly long relaxation
